column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Running until April 26
column3: "Becoming Edvard Munch" focuses on the life of Munch
column4: and the influences he drew upon in his work. Note: the fee of $10 is charged for this exhibit during Free February
column5: but it's well worth it. Drawing from its collection
column6: the Art Institute has built a series of rooms that each focus on a period or style of Edvard Munch. We see how Impressionism influenced his work
column7: or his reaction to it in subject and style. No artist comes into the world fully realized
column8: and I loved this exhibit's reach. I especially enjoyed seeing fellow Norwegian artists that were obvious influences once seen side by side with Munch
column9: but largely unknown. The Audio Tour for this exhibit is $6
column10: but I found it to be largely uninspiring. Reading the main statements in each of the rooms was plenty of information!
